name: Introduction to the Visual Arts (GT-AH1)
description: Course Description: Exploration of the development of visual arts.
column10: Additional Information:  Arts & Humanities 3B, Arts & Expression (GT-AH1).
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Issues and Practices in Art  Credit
description: Course Description: Current issues, practices, and resources in the visual arts; integration of unified vocabulary in various art disciplines.

name: Global Art History I
description: Course Description: Art and architecture of the ancient world.

name: Global Art History II
description: Course Description: Art and architecture in the era of global connection.

name: Foundations--Time and Structure
description: Course Description: Establishes a foundational understanding of digital literacy as part of a creative practice through the development of experimental media artworks in relation to interdisciplinary concepts.

name: Foundations - Form and Observation
description: Course Description: Foundational understanding of visual literacy as part of a creative practice through the development of two-dimensional artworks exploring form through observational methods in relation to interdisciplinary concepts.

name: Introduction to Figure Drawing
description: Course Description: Human form as basis for self-expression through various drawing media.

name: Foundations - Color and Composition
description: Course Description: Establishes a foundational understanding of color and composition as part of a creative practice through the development of artworks using two-dimensional methods in relation to interdisciplinary concepts.

name: Foundations - Materials and Space
description: Course Description: Establishes a foundational understanding of materials and space as part of a creative practice through the development of three-dimensional artworks in relation to interdisciplinary concepts.

name: Media Arts in Context
description: Course Description: History and contemporary practice of media-based arts. Addresses printmaking, graphic design, photography, film, video, computer-generated imagery, digital fabrication, and other cognate disciplines.
column11: Registration Information: Offered as an online course only.

name: Global Art History III
description: Course Description: Global modern and contemporary art and architecture.

name: Photo Image Making I
description: Course Description: Photographic imagery as an art medium; exploration of silver-based (film) materials.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ART 111 and ART 120 and ART 135 and ART 160 and ART 170.

name: Photo Image Making for Non-Art Majors
description: Course Description: Create photographically-based artworks, and assess works through critical interactions.
column11: Registration Information: Non-Art majors only. Credit not allowed for both ART 231 and ART 280A1.

name: Drawing Materials and Techniques
description: Course Description: Introducing fundamental skills and knowledge in drawing emphasizing a variety of processes, techniques and materials while exploring thematic topics.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ART 111 and ART 120 and ART 135 and ART 160 and ART 170.

name: Figure Drawing
description: Course Description: Develop and employ observational drawing methods centered on the motif of the human form. Explore the nature of observation, representation, and the role of the human being and human form in art. Discover the spatial morphology of the human form and analyze a diverse range of drawing genres that use the human form as a motif.

name: Pottery I
description: Course Description: Basic techniques of studio ceramics and wheel throwing; exploration of expressive potential in pottery.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ART 111 and ART 120 and ART 135 and ART 160 and ART 170.

name: Metalsmithing and Jewelry I
description: Course Description: Introduction to the materials, processes, and concepts that ground the field of contemporary jewelry and metalsmithing. Techniques include metal forming and fabrication processes; jewelry design and construction; surface treatment and finishing processes; behavior and mechanical properties of metals.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ART 111 and ART 120 and ART 135 and ART 160 and ART 170.

name: Fibers I
description: Course Description: Fibers and fabric as expressive media; weaving and basic fiber structures; fabric painting and surface techniques.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ART 111 and ART 120 and ART 135 and ART 160 and ART 170.

name: Digital Fabrication
description: Course Description: Practical and technical skills within a historical and theoretical context for using computers, in combination with traditional and analog fabrication processes, to shape physical materials and make creative works. Introduces 3D Computer Aided Design (CAD), Computer Aided Machining (CAM), and Computer Numeric Controlled (CNC) Machining including 3D printing, Laser Cutting, and CNC Routing/Milling.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ART 110 or ART 135 or ART 136 or ART 160 or ART 170.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Introduction to Graphic Design
description: Course Description: An introduction to visual communication design, typography, design systems, and layout.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ART 111 and ART 120 and ART 135 and ART 160 and ART 170.
column11: Registration Information: 2.55 GPA or better.

name: Introduction to Electronic Art
description: Course Description: An introduction to interactive and time-based mediums for art making. Course material may include sound art, video, coding and/or animation as a basis for creation.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ART 111 and ART 120 and ART 135 and ART 160 and ART 170.

name: Painting I--Fundamentals and Representation
description: Course Description: Beginning oil painting focusing on development of technical skills while exploring concepts of representation in western and non-western art.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ART 111 and ART 120 and ART 135 and ART 160 and ART 170.

name: Printmaking I-Introduction to Printmaking
description: Course Description: Introduction to the materials, processes, and concepts that ground the field of contemporary printmaking. Explore multiple techniques of printmaking. Develop an individual artistic practice.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ART 111 and ART 120 and ART 135 and ART 160 and ART 170.

name: History and Practice of Non-Toxic Printmaking
description: Course Description: Brief history of traditional printmaking practices to provide exposure to contemporary non-toxic printmaking practices through a hands-on studio.
column11: Registration Information: Must register for lecture and laboratory. Offered as Mixed Face-to-Face only. Credit not allowed for both ART 266 and ART 380A2.

name: Sculpture I
description: Course Description: Introduction to sculptural techniques and concepts.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ART 111 and ART 120 and ART 135 and ART 160 and ART 170.

description: Course Description:

description: Course Description:

name: J  Independent Study: Pottery
description: Course Description:

name: K  Independent Study: Photo Image Making
description: Course Description:

name: L  Independent Study: Electronic Art
description: Course Description: Students work with one faculty member to create course content relevant to electronic art.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ART 100 to 399 - at least 3 credits.
column11: Registration Information: Junior standing. Written consent of instructor. Instructor must approve of proposed course content from student prior to registration.

name: Pre-Columbian Art of the Andes
description: Course Description: Artistic and architectural traditions of major ancient civilizations in the central Andean region of South America, including the Chavín, Nazca, Moche, Tiwanaku, and Inca cultures from 2500 bce until the sixteenth-century conquest and colonization by Spain.

name: Art of West and Central Africa
description: Course Description: Focuses on the arts of West and Central Africa from prehistory through contemporary visual expressions, and engages with current art historical theoretical approaches and practices in order to gain a nuanced understanding of the arts in these respective regions and their relationship to global art production.

name: Pre-Columbian Art of Mesoamerica
description: Course Description: Artistic and architectural traditions of major ancient civilizations in Mesoamerica, including the Olmecs, Maya, Teotihuacanoes, Mixtecs, and Aztecs, from 1200 bce until the sixteenth-century conquest by Spain.

name: Art of East and Southern Africa
description: Course Description: Arts of southern and East Africa from prehistory through contemporary visual expressions, and engages with current art historical theoretical approaches and practices to gain a nuanced understanding of the arts in these respective regions and their relationship to global art production.

name: United States Art 1945-1980
description: Course Description: Visual art in the United States 1945-1980.

name: Art of the Pacific
description: Course Description: Arts of Australia, Indonesia, Melanesia, Micronesia, and Polynesia.

name: Native North American Art
description: Course Description: Introduction to historic and contemporary art forms of Native North America, emphasizing the cultural and political contexts.
column11: Registration Information: Written consent of instructor for non-Art majors.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Global Encounters in Art
description: Course Description: Comparative topics in global art.

name: A  Travel Abroad: Studio Workshop in Italy-Drawing
description: Course Description: Exploration of studio techniques in Italy.

name: B  Travel Abroad: Studio Workshop in Italy-Photo Image Making
description: Course Description: Exploration of studio techniques in Italy.
column11: Registration Information: ART 230 or portfolio review; written consent of instructor.Term Offered: Summer.

name: C  Travel Abroad: Studio Workshop in Italy-Fibers
description: Course Description: Exploration of studio techniques in Italy.
column11: Registration Information: ART 250 or portfolio review; written consent of instructor.Term Offered: Summer.

name: D  Travel Abroad: Studio Workshop in Italy-Sculpture
description: Course Description: Exploration of studio techniques in Italy.

name: A  Study Abroad-–Mexico: Art Meets Environment
description: Course Description: Explores the intersection of visual arts, community and environment in Baja California Sur through direct experience, creative practice, collaborative processes and contemporary and historical art theory.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  CO 150. Restriction: Must not be a: Freshman.
column11: Registration Information: Sophomore standing. Written consent of instructor. Offered as Mixed Face-to-Face.

name: Concepts in Art Education
description: Course Description: Artistic learning in children, adolescents, adults, and special populations.
column11: Registration Information: Admission to Teacher Licensure Program required.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Art Education Studio
description: Course Description: Art areas required for teacher licensure as indicated by individual student needs.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ART 325 with a minimum grade of C.
column11: Registration Information: Junior standing. Admission to Teacher Licensure Program required. Written consent of instructor.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Issues in Art Education and the Public
description: Course Description: Introduce students to the concepts relating to Art Education in contemporary society.
column11: Registration Information: Junior standing. This is a partial semester course. Offered as an online course only.Term Offered: Summer.

name: Photo Image Making II
description: Course Description: Studio course designed to develop the growth of photographic expression.
column11: Registration Information: ART 230 or portfolio review.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Photo Image Making III
description: Course Description: Studio course designed to further growth of concept, materials in photographic expression as an art medium.

name: Contemporary Topics in Drawing
description: Course Description: Broadening knowledge and skills in drawing by emphasizing a variety of approaches and materials while exploring contemporary topics.

name: Projects in Drawing
description: Course Description: Generate and synthesize drawing-based project work through dedicated artistic research. Identify relevant contemporary issues and formulate personalized drawing practices through in-depth projects. Each project is invented and justified through a written proposal, artist statement, oral presentations, and sketchbook work, prior to fully evaluated tangible works of art.

name: Pottery II
description: Course Description: Studio ceramic and wheel throwing techniques; surface treatment, kiln firing, clay and glaze formulation.

name: Pottery III
description: Course Description: Form and surface exploration; supportive ceramic technologies; expression in historical pottery.

name: Metalsmithing and Jewelry II
description: Course Description: Raising and casting techniques in combination with construction; metal spinning.

name: Metalsmithing and Jewelry III
description: Course Description: Forging and enameling techniques on nonferrous and ferrous metals; stone setting.

name: Fibers II
description: Course Description: Intermediate fiber structures and fabric and surface design; dyes and pigments; continued investigation of fibers and fabric as expressive media.

name: Fibers III
description: Course Description: Investigation of fibers and fabric as expressive media; research in historic textiles.

name: Typography and Design Systems
description: Course Description: Emphasis on typographic solutions for advertising, corporate identity, packaging, and publication design.

name: Illustration
description: Course Description: Problems emphasizing media, experimental techniques, and compositions.
column11: Registration Information: Six credits in drawing required in addition to ART 255.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Interactive Media
description: Course Description: Technical, conceptual, and historic aspects of creating interactive electronic media.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ART 255 or ART 256.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Experimental Video
description: Course Description: History, theory, application of experimental video and digital special effects,  animation and video techniques as they apply to experimental video.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ART 255 or ART 256.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Painting II--Ideation and Concept Development
description: Course Description: Continuing development of technical skills in oil painting through the use of conceptual prompts.

name: Painting III--Experimental Approaches
description: Course Description: Broadening knowledge and skill in the painting discipline by introducing experimental processes, methods and materials.

name: Printmaking II-Lithography
description: Course Description: Preparation, processing, and printing techniques in stone and metal plate lithography.

name: Printmaking III-Studio Workshop
description: Course Description: Advanced intaglio, relief, planographic, and stencil processes in the workshop, continued emphasis on individual creative growth.

name: Sculpture III
description: Course Description: Intermediate-level development of studio practice, exploration of technical process, theory and professionalism.

name: A  Study Abroad in Japan: Art History
description: Course Description: History of Japanese art and architecture experienced on location in Japan.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ART 110 or ART 120 or ART 135 or ART 160 or ART 170.Term Offered: Summer (every third year).

name: B  Study Abroad in Japan: Studio Art
description: Course Description: Investigation of Japanese art and design experienced on location in Japan.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ART 110 or ART 120 or ART 135 or ART 160 or ART 170.Term Offered: Summer (every third year).

name: C  Study Abroad: Art Meets Environment in Baja California Sur
description: Course Description: Explores the intersection of visual arts, community and environment in Baja California Sur through direct experience, creative practice, collaborative processes and contemporary and historical art theory.
column11: Registration Information: Sophomore standing. Written consent of instructor. Offered as Mixed Face-to-Face.

name: D  Study Abroad--Italy: Painting
description: Course Description: Exploration of studio techniques in Italy.

name: Supervised College Teaching
description: Course Description: Supervised assistance in instruction.
column11: Registration Information: Junior or senior standing; written consent of instructor. Maximum of 10 combined credits for all 384 and 484 courses are counted towards graduation requirements.

name: Undergraduate Professional Practices Seminar
description: Course Description: Skills and tools beneficial in pursuing professional and/or academic goals in the visual arts.
column11: Registration Information: Junior standing. Sections may be offered: Online.

name: BFA Portfolio  Credit
description: Course Description: Effectively submit capstone work to the University's Digital Repository and a Juried BFA Exhibition while teaching best practices for managing and sharing work after graduation.
column11: Registration Information: Senior standing. Written consent of instructor. This is a partial semester course.

name: Museum Collections--Storage to Exhibition
description: Course Description: Introduction to issues involving museum collections. Topics are addressed through readings, documentary films, class discussions, guest speakers, gallery tours, object research, and hands-on projects. Work closely with objects from the Gregory Allicar Museum of Art collection.

name: History of Medieval Art
description: Course Description: Early Christian, Byzantine, Islamic, Romanesque, and Gothic visual art forms.

name: History of Baroque and Rococo Art
description: Course Description: 17th- and 18th-century visual arts.

name: History of 19th Century European Art
description: Course Description: Architecture, sculpture, painting, and other arts in Europe, 1780 - 1900.

name: History of European Art, 1900 to 1945
description: Course Description: Visual arts in Europe, 1900 to 1945.

name: Roman Art
description: Course Description: Roman sculpture, painting, and architecture.

name: Contemporary Artists and Art Critics
description: Course Description: Critical study of contemporary artists and art criticism.

name: Historiography and Methodology of Art History
description: Course Description: Historiography/methodology/research methods in art history.
column11: Registration Information: Written consent of instructor.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Travel Abroad-Art History in Italy
description: Course Description: Art historical study of painting, sculpture, and architecture in Italy.

name: Art and Environment
description: Course Description: Interdisciplinary studio/seminar course investigating art's relationship to the environment through readings, field trips, presentations and studio practice.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ART 136 and ART 160 and ART 170 and ART 200 to 299 - at least 6 credits.
column11: Registration Information: Required field trips. Credit allowed for only one of the following: ART 380A1, ART 421, ART 521 or ART 680A1.

name: Integrated Visual Studies
description: Course Description: Interdisciplinary and guided study linking systems of knowledge. Students are afforded the space to draw on their breadth of information and artistic mediums to create a capstone project that demonstrates an ability to communicate effectively across verbal, visual, and written forms. Develop skills as makers and thinkers, fostering critical awareness of how society reflects and produces visual meaning.
column11: Registration Information: Senior standing. Written consent of advisor. 21 credits of upper-division coursework in the BA-Integrated Visual Studies concentration.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Advanced Photo Image Making I
description: Course Description: Advanced problems in use of photo image making as an art medium.

name: Advanced Photo Image Making II
description: Course Description: Studio course to refine individual directions and professional goals in photography as an art medium.

name: Advanced Drawing I
description: Course Description: Independent projects and identification of personal artistic direction; research in art-related topics.

name: Advanced Drawing II
description: Course Description: Capstone course; production of professional exhibition-quality work.

name: Pottery IV
description: Course Description: Advanced individual research in pottery form and expression; supportive technology; expression in contemporary American pottery.

name: Pottery V
description: Course Description: Advanced individual research in pottery form and expression of personal subject matter; supportive technology.

name: Metalsmithing and Jewelry IV
description: Course Description: Chasing and repousse techniques in two- and three-dimension; inlay, engraving, and etching techniques.

name: Metalsmithing and Jewelry V
description: Course Description: Advanced techniques: granulation, electroforming, photoetching, makume, niello, ferrous metals techniques.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ART 345 and ART 346.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Fibers IV
description: Course Description: Advanced studio problems in expressive use of fibers and fabric.
column11: Registration Information: Maximum of 8 credits allowed in the course.

name: Fibers V
description: Course Description: Advanced studio problems in expressive use of fibers and fabric.
column11: Registration Information: Maximum of 8 credits allowed in course.

name: Advanced Typography and Design Systems
description: Course Description: Two- and three-dimensional solutions for advertising, corporate identity, packaging, and publication design.
column11: Registration Information: Maximum of 8 credits allowed in course.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Advanced Illustration
description: Course Description: Projects in editorial and reportorial illustration emphasizing techniques applied to solving problems in advanced composition.
column11: Registration Information: Maximum of 8 credits allowed in course.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Advanced Interactive Media
description: Course Description: Technical, conceptual, and historic aspects of creating interactive electronic media.

name: Advanced Experimental Video
description: Course Description: Advanced experimental video and visual effects.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  (ART 255 or ART 256) and (ART 358).Term Offered: Fall.

name: Painting IV--Portfolio Projects
description: Course Description: Exploration of the fundamental conceptual and logistical challenges involved in developing a proficient, personal art practice in the discipline of painting.

name: Painting V--Capstone Portfolio Projects
description: Course Description: Continuation of personal portfolio development with culminating capstone expectations added.

name: Printmaking IV-Studio Workshop
description: Course Description: Advanced printmaking workshop; intaglio, relief, planographic, and stencil; continued emphasis on individual creative growth.

name: Printmaking V-Studio Workshop
description: Course Description: Advanced printmaking concepts in studio and research problems.
column11: Registration Information: Maximum of 8 credits allowed in course.

name: Sculpture V
description: Course Description: Advanced expression using sculptural techniques.
column11: Registration Information: Maximum of 8 credits allowed in course.

name: A  Study Abroad
description: Course Description: Special topics in Italian art history; most classes will be taught on-site at museums, churches, and galleries in Italy. Focus on the art and architecture of the famed Michelangelo Buonarroti.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ART 212.Term Offered: Spring (every third year).

name: Internship
description: Course Description: Supervised work experience in an approved location.
column11: Registration Information: Junior or senior standing; written consent of instructor.
